description: Economies define production, consumption, and neutral-category biases for system markets. Systems have one primary economy and may have multiple secondary economies. Economies add bias only; they do not imply population size, technology level, legality, or development.

economies.name: Mining
economies.description: Focused on extraction of raw and refined materials.

economies.name: Agricultural
economies.description: Biological production including foodstuffs and organic compounds.

economies.name: Industrial
economies.description: Large-scale manufacturing, processing, and power generation.

economies.name: Tech
economies.description: Advanced technology development and information systems.

economies.name: Tourism
economies.description: Visitor-focused economy emphasizing experiences, prestige, and culture.

economies.name: Cultural
economies.description: Artistic, heritage, and influence-driven economic activity.

economies.name: Trade
economies.description: Exchange-focused economy that broadens markets by increasing the range of neutral categories present.

economies.name: Research
economies.description: Experimental and cutting-edge development, often power-intensive and component-hungry.
